lines.text: We spend too much time thinking about the end of the world. It isn't going to happen. Today. I promise you. Not before lunch.

[to Sinclair's boatman]
Is he going to kill me, do you think?
Being single...
What about it?
It's not as simple as it used to be.
Come into the church and feel no guilt... come on, I dare you!
I don't believe this, Richard, the vanity... now get out of here before I lose my temper.
But I was just asking you out.
I thought you were meant to be something of an expert, you seem decidely rusty to me.
Rusty, certainly not, what's the answer?
No. No! I've never seen anybody so obviously thinking about another...
Another what?
I was going to say a woman, but it's more likely to be a 15-year old girl, isn't it? Who is she? Are you at a loose end tonight because of her? Or are you trying to forget her?
She's lying to me, all the time. When people lie to you, you suddenly can't think of anything else.
You've spotted little signs, have you?
...little signs... didn't need to. She's been carrying around a giant placard saying, "I've been fucking somebody else."
I knew you'd want this to end with one of us getting killed. Trust you to get both of us nearly killed.
Something tells me its the end of the party.
I knew there was something extraordinary between you two, something which had to be purged. I don't want to know. There is a limit beyond which I can't go.
Those fires, a typical end to summer.
I certainly wouldn't call this summer typical.
And to think, we didn't even really like each other as kids.
Oh, go on, you can read it, I can see you edging toward it.
Just one chapter. It's the only thing that shuts me up.
How's the food?
Food? You would ask that.
You wanted to be artistic.
I'm not artistic.
But you wanted to be.
She went for a job, he was the boss. She didn't get the job, she got him.
I love you.
Of course you do.
Do you love me?
Of course I do.
I thought I heard voices.
Just my secretary, we're alone together.
You're probably screwing her.
As a matter of fact I am.
Other people's children are wonderful, aren't they?
I have to get permission, I'll have to ask my 14 year-old boss.
These ashtrays are interesting, they're ridiculously large. People proclaim their importance in such a crass fashion. What will historians make of these ashtrays?
You're interested in everything, Sinclair.
These lists, ashtrays, this secretary here, you.
[first lines]
You're late.
Sorry, it was unavoidable, trains on Sunday, you know what they're like.
Unavoidable? I don't believe it. I've eaten all the food.
You've eaten all the food? Now that's serious.
I do believe, I have to confess, in spending money , not just hoarding it.
